intro: Anchusa lutea, commonly known as the yellow bugloss, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense spikes. Anchusa lutea is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is also valued for its ecological benefits.
